info.name: NotificationAPI
info.description:
## üëã Introduction

Welcome to the [NotificationAPI](https://notificationapi.com/) API Docs üöÄüöÄ

## üõü Help and support

We are gradually documenting our APIs üê¢ If you don't see something, just send us a message in the chat, and we'll get it updated in minutes üêá

## Glossary

- `envId` refers to the account or environment you are modifying
    
- `user` refers to an end-user, the recipient of notifications
    
- `member` refers to your team members with access to the dashboard
    
- `notification` refers to a notification type that you configure in our dashboard, for example: `new_comment_notification`

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Generally used for **server-to-server** connections where you have control over the client secret, for example, in your back-end.

This method uses the BASIC authorization model:

```
Authorization: BASIC BASE64("CLIENT_ID:CLIENT_SECRET")

 ```

Example in JavaScript:

``` javascript
Authorization: Buffer.from(`${clientId}:${clientSecret}`).toString("base64")

 ```

item.name: Client ID and User ID Example

request.description:
Generally used for Client-to-Server communication where client-side code (front-end or mobile app) is communicating with our server on behalf of a user. This method prevents your client secret from being exposed and only provides the client access to a specific user's information.

This method also uses the BASIC authorization model:

```
Authorization: BASIC BASE64("CLIENT_ID:USER_ID")

 ```

Example in JavaScript:

``` javascript
Authorization: BASIC Buffer.from(`${clientId}:${userId}`).toString("base64")

 ```

item.name: Client ID and User ID Secure Mode Example

request.description:
To prevent users from impersonating each other, you can enable secure mode ([learn more](https://docs.notificationapi.com/guides/secure-mode)). In secure mode, you need to append the user's hashedUserId to the string that is being encoded:

```
Authorization: BASIC BASE64("CLIENT_ID:USER_ID:HASHED_USER_ID")

 ```

Example in JavaScript:

``` javascript
Authorization: BASIC Buffer.from(`${clientId}:${userId}:${hashedUserId}`).toString("base64")

 ```

To test secure mode correctly, you need to enable Secure Mode in your account.

item.description:
There are two modes of authentication supported depending on the end-points being used. Some end-points support both modes, while others support only one.

- **Client ID + Client Secret:** Authenticates your server with us. Used in your server-side code and our server SDKs.
    
- **Client ID + User ID:** Authenticates your end-user with us. Used in your web and mobile apps and our front-end SDKs.
    
    - Also supports a Secure Mode (see explanation below)

item.name: Sub Notifications

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.description:
Sub notifications are used to provide more granularity to end-users in their notification preferences. With subNotificationId, a user can sub/unsub to a subgroup of a notification.

Learn more [here](https://docs.notificationapi.com/features/subnotifications).

request.description:
Used to subscribe or update the subscription preferences of a user for a notification or subNotification.

There are two ways to invoke:

- If only notificationId or notificationId+subNotificationId are passed, the user is subscribed to that notification using the defaults settings of the notification.
    
- If channel and delivery are explicitly specified, the user subscription is set to those options.
    

Valid values for channels: `EMAIL`, `INAPP_WEB`, `SMS`, `CALL`, `PUSH`, `WEB_PUSH`

Valid values for delivery are: `off`, `instant`, `hourly`, `daily`, `weekly`, and `monthly`.
For a detailed description of parameters and options, visit [here](https://docs.notificationapi.com/reference/server#send).

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description: Update an already scheduled notification. The Request Body is similar to the Body when triggering the notification, but only with fields that you want to override or update.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description: Deletes a notification that has been scheduled using the "scheduled" field.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description:
Gets the user's in-app notifications from newest to oldest.

The before parameter is optional and is used for the pagination. Recommended workflow:

1. Request the first page of notifications (no before)
    
2. Store the timestamp of the oldest notification (the last notification in the response array since the array is sorted chronologically)
    
3. Pass that value as the "before" parameter for the next API call
    

The "before" parameter is inclusive (less than and equals) to ensure notifications that are stored within one millisecond are not missed. This results in repeated notifications being returned. Make sure to drop response notifications with the same ID.

response.name: 200 Response

request.description:
This endpoint lets you set an in-app notification to opened, archived, ...

Parameters:

- `trackingIds` is an array of trackingIds
    
- Other parameters are optional and must be set to an ISO date (with the exception of reply)
Returns the number of unread in-app notifications.

This method is used to mark one or all notifications of the user as read.

- To mark all as read: pass an empty object in body: `{}`
    
- To mark a single notification, use the notification's `trackingId` in the body

Unsubscribes a user from a specific type of notification and channel.

CHANNEL_TYPE is specified in the querystring and is one of: `EMAIL`, `INAPP_WEB`, `SMS`, `CALL`, `PUSH`, `WEB_PUSH`

This is like using the Update User Preferences function to set the user's preference to OFF.

## Authorization

This endpoint's authorization works like the BASIC base64("clientId:userId") authentication, except that the token (base64 part) should be passed in the query string.

query.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description:
Used to subscribe or update the subscription preferences of a user for a notification or subNotification.

There are two ways to invoke:

- **Use Defaults:** Only pass notificationId or notificationId+subNotificationId in the body, for the user setting to follow the notification's default settings. E.g., if the notification is set to deliver hourly over email, the user's preference will be set to hourly email.
- **Custom:** Specify channel and delivery to explicitly set the user's subscription settings.
    

Valid values for channels: `EMAIL`, `INAPP_WEB`, `SMS`, `CALL`, `PUSH`, `WEB_PUSH`

Valid values for delivery are: `off`, `instant`, `hourly`, `daily`, `weekly`, and `monthly`.

request.description:
### Endpoint Description

This endpoint allows you to create or update an email template for a specific notification identified by `notificationId`. The request is made using the HTTP POST method, and it requires authentication to access the resource.

### Authentication

This request requires **Basic Authentication**. You must provide a username (clientId) and password (clientSecret) to access the endpoint. The credentials should be encoded in Base64 format.

**Authorization Header Format:**

```
Authorization: Basic base64(clientId:clientSecret)

 ```

To encode your credentials, concatenate your username and password with a colon (`:`) in between, and then convert the resulting string to Base64.

### Request Parameters

The request body must be in JSON format and should include the following parameters:

- **templateId** (string): The unique identifier for the email template.
    
- **subject** (string): The subject line of the email.
    
- **html** (string): The HTML content of the email body.
    
- **internal** (string): JSON for the internal editor to create the notification template.
    
- **previewText** (string): A short preview text that may be displayed in the email client.
    
- **senderName** (string): The name of the sender as it will appear in the email.
    
- **senderEmail** (string): The email address of the sender.
    

### Response Structure

The response will return a JSON object. If the request is successful, the response will incde "envId", "notificationId", "templateId" and other relevant information. However, in the case of an unauthorized request (HTTP status 401), the response will contain a message indicating the lack of proper authentication.

Example of a successful response:

``` json
{
  "envId": "o93otcvvcp87us1yhy5e04d6q5",
  "notificationId": "test_email_notification",
  "templateId": "TEMPLATE_ID",
  "channel": "EMAIL",
  "html": "<string>",
  "internal": "<string>",
  "subject": "<string>",
  "default": false,
  "isDefaultFor": {
    "instant": false,
    "hourly": false,
    "daily": false,
    "weekly": false,
    "monthly": false
  },
  "senderName": "<string>",
  "senderEmail": "<string>",
  "previewText": "<string>"
}

 ```

This response structure provides confirmation of the updated template and its properties.

### Error Handling

If the request fails due to authentication issues, the response will return a status code of 401 along with a message:

``` json
{
    "message": "Unauthorized"
}

 ```

Ensure that you have the necessary permissions and valid credentials when making this request.

request.description:
## PATCH Notification Template

This endpoint allows you to update the template for a specific notification channel associated with a given client.

### Authentication

This request requires **Basic Authentication**. You must provide a username (clientId) and password (clientSecret) to access the endpoint. The credentials should be encoded in Base64 format.

**Authorization Header Format:**

```
Authorization: Basic base64(clientId:clientSecret)

 ```

To encode your credentials, concatenate your username and password with a colon (`:`) in between, and then convert the resulting string to Base64.

### Request

**Method:** `PATCH`  
**Endpoint:** `{{baseUrl}}/:clientId/notifications/:notificationId/templates/:channel/:templateId`

### Request Body

The request body must be in JSON format and include the following parameters:

- **subject** (string): The subject line of the notification.
    
- **previewText** (string): A brief preview of the notification content.
    
- **html** (string): The HTML content of the notification.
    
- **internal** (string): JSON for the internal editor to create the notification template.
    
- **senderName** (string): The name of the sender.
    
- **senderEmail** (string): The email address of the sender.
    

### Response Structure

The response will return a JSON object. If the request is successful, the response will incde "envId", "notificationId", "templateId" and other relevant information. However, in the case of an unauthorized request (HTTP status 401), the response will contain a message indicating the lack of proper authentication.

Example of a successful response:

``` json
{
  "envId": "o93otcvvcp87us1yhy5e04d6q5",
  "notificationId": "test_email_notification",
  "templateId": "TEMPLATE_ID",
  "channel": "EMAIL",
  "html": "<string>",
  "internal": "<string>",
  "subject": "<string>",
  "default": true,
  "isDefaultFor": {
    "instant": true,
    "hourly": true,
    "daily": true,
    "weekly": true,
    "monthly": true
  },
  "senderName": "<string>",
  "senderEmail": "<string>",
  "previewText": "<string>"
}

 ```

This response structure provides confirmation of the updated template and its properties.

response.name: 200 response
response.body:
{
    "envId": "o93otcvvcp87us1yhy5e04d6q5",
    "notificationId": "test_email_notification",

    "internal": "<string>",

        "instant": false,
        "hourly": false,
        "daily": false,
        "weekly": false,
        "monthly": false
    },
    "senderName": "<string>",
    "senderEmail": "<string>",
    "previewText": "<string>"
}

request.description:
### Endpoint Description

This endpoint retrieves the notification template associated with a specific notification and channel for a given client.

### Authentication

This request requires **Basic Authentication**. You must provide a username (clientId) and password (clientSecret) to access the endpoint. The credentials should be encoded in Base64 format.

**Authorization Header Format:**

```
Authorization: Basic base64(clientId:clientSecret)

 ```

To encode your credentials, concatenate your username and password with a colon (`:`) in between, and then convert the resulting string to Base64.

### Request Parameters

- **clientId**: The unique identifier for the client whose notification template is being accessed.
    
- **notificationId**: The unique identifier for the specific notification.
    
- **channel**: The communication channel through which the notification will be sent (e.g., email, SMS).
    
- **templateId**: The unique identifier for the template being requested.
    

### Response

On a successful request, the API returns a JSON object with the following fields:

- **envId**: The environment identifier.
    
- **notificationId**: The identifier of the notification.
    
- **templateId**: The identifier of the template.
    
- **channel**: The channel through which the notification is sent.
    
- **html**: The HTML content of the template.
    
- **internal**: JSON for the internal editor to create the notification template.
    
- **subject**: The subject line for the notification.
    
- **default**: A boolean indicating if this is the default template.
    
- **isDefaultFor**: An object indicating the default status for various frequencies (instant, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly).
    
- **senderName**: The name of the sender.
    
- **senderEmail**: The email address of the sender.
    
- **previewText**: A preview text for the notification.
    

### Notes

- Ensure that valid identifiers are provided for the client, notification, and template to retrieve the correct template.
    
- The response will indicate if the template is the default one and for which frequencies it is applicable.

    "previewText": "<string>"
}

request.description:
## DELETE Notification Template

This endpoint is used to delete a specific notification template associated with a given channel for a particular client. By making a DELETE request to this endpoint, you can remove a template identified by its `templateId`.

### Authentication

This request requires **Basic Authentication**. You must provide a username (clientId) and password (clientSecret) to access the endpoint. The credentials should be encoded in Base64 format.

**Authorization Header Format:**

```
Authorization: Basic base64(clientId:clientSecret)

 ```

To encode your credentials, concatenate your username and password with a colon (`:`) in between, and then convert the resulting string to Base64.

### Request Format

- **HTTP Method**: DELETE
    
- **Endpoint**: `{{baseUrl}}/{{clientId}}/notifications/{{notificationId}}/templates/{{channel}}/{{templateId}}`
    

### Path Parameters

- `clientId`: The unique identifier for the client.
    
- `notificationId`: The unique identifier for the notification.
    
- `channel`: The communication channel through which the notification is sent (e.g., email, SMS).
    
- `templateId`: The unique identifier for the template that you wish to delete.
    

### Response Structure

The response for this request may vary. A successful deletion typically returns a status code indicating the operation was successful. In this case, the response will contain `no content`, indicating that the template has been successfully deleted and there is no further information to return.

### Notes

- Ensure that the `clientId`, `notificationId`, `channel`, and `templateId` are correctly specified in the URL to successfully delete the desired template.
    
- This operation is irreversible; once a template is deleted, it cannot be recovered.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: /:envId/notifications/:notificationId

request.description:
Returns all the templates of a notification for a specific channel.

Accepted channel values: EMAIL, INAPP_WEB, SMS, CALL, PUSH, WEB_PUSH

request.description:
Admins can use this endpoint to **remove a user from suppression lists**, allowing them to receive notifications again.

## üõ°Ô∏è Notes & Best Practices

- ‚úÖ **Fix root issues first**: Before removing a user from suppression, ensure their email address is valid and they want to receive emails.
    
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Use this endpoint with caution**: Removing users from suppression lists without addressing the root cause (like invalid addresses or spam complaints) can harm your **sender reputation** and increase bounce rates
    
- üåê **Environment Awareness**: Double-check you‚Äôre using the right environment (Production, Staging, etc.) to avoid unwanted changes.
Checks a number of our internal services to ensure everything is working fine.
